message.body: Hey do you still have my tile bucket? I can't find anywhere.
Yes. Can I borrow some big sds bits
Yeah it's in my living room next to ping pong table
Ok. Thx
This pit is cray! Are you trying to replace your soil line?
yeah. I gotta do same thing at the shop. Sux
Sewer or water line?
Sewer. Also beware that osha has started sending out sentinels to inspect sites. Every 4' down that you dig requires shoring. Plumber I know got a fine for being at 5' without shoring - $30k!!!
Vertical boards with cross bracing. Maybe keeping a pitch is fine. Dunno. But yeah $30k is insane.

You mean keeping a pitch to your hole or putting in piles to hold the dirt wall? 30k is preposterous. I assumed I would get fined by l&i but that it would be a fraction of what I would have to pay a plumber to actually do the work

The best price I found for that work was "best choice plumbing". $4700 for digging under 15' of sidewalk and replacing concrete. Probably around $2k for you at this point since you've done half the work.
I gotta trench out my basement floor a little too. But thanks for the ref. maybe I will just pay them so I don't get a crazy fine
I know. Digging this clay is brutal
I think so. But if you are wanting him for painting i'd look elsewhere. He's insanely expensive now.
Nah I'm just trying to get rid of some corbels. Also getting rid of that plastic decking and your little chop saw table if you want em
Chop saw table?
I also have a rolling tool organizer if you want for free for the shop
Oh yeah. Fer sure.
That little thing the ryobi chop was on and my router table was on
Hmmm can't picture. What are the corbels? I might be into those too.
Are you around tonight? I can swing by after work.
Real simple from my house but could save u a lotta trouble if you ever needed em. Also getting rid of this flooring
I'll be around tonight
Ok. I'll be by around 6 or 7.
I just got done work and am beat. You around tomorrow morn?
I'll be around tomorrow
Cool. I'll text you in the morning before I leave.
